result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Wayne Piel Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Wayne Piel Jr

records.addlTxt: Defendant Allen Wayne Piel Jr in court.  Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Donald Ritchey Stroud III in court for Allen Wayne Piel Jr. Attorney Stroud heard and requests to withdraw from case. Attorney Pozorski heard on plea offer. Defendant heard and will take plea offer. Short recess. Back on the record. Attorney Stroud heard and will remain on the case. State moves to amend charge to county ordinance. Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Stroud heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard. Court heard and orders $100 fine plus court costs. Bond previously posted to be applied.

Prior: 108 West Amelia St. #4, Cassville, WI 53806

Defendant Allen Wayne Piel Jr in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Donald Ritchey Stroud III in court for Allen Wayne Piel Jr. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charge. Court sets status date.
Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall have no contact with Victim 1. 
Defendant shall contact State Public Defender's Office today @ 608-401-2030.

Defendant Allen Wayne Piel Jr appeared by video, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Zoom was not approved. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant does not currently have a place to live. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests $150 cash bond remain with a condition not to have contact with Vicitm 1. Court order $150 cash bond remain with the conditions to have no contact with Victim 1 and to contact SPD today. Court informed defendant that bond will not be mailed and that he has until the end of the week to get it signed at the Clerk's Office. Arraignment date set.
Arraignment scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
